insa.h4401.model

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • insa.h4401.model.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Publisher

    public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
implements Publisher
    This class represents a map, a graph, composed of arcs (streets) and nodes (crossroads).
    Author:
    Lisa, Estelle, Antoine, Pierre, Hugues, Guillaume, Paul

      Returns a list of all arcs present in the map

    • Method Detail

      • getArcs

        public java.util.List<Arc> getArcs()
        Returns a list of all arcs present in the map
        Returns:
        The arcs contained in the map.

      • getNodes

        public java.util.Collection<Node> getNodes()
        Returns a collection of all nodes present in the map
        Returns:
        All the nodes contained in the map.

      • createNode

        public Node createNode(int id,
                       java.awt.Point location)
        Factory method to build nodes in map.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the node.
        location - The location (x, y) of the node.
        Returns:
        The node newly created and added to the map.

      • createArc

        public Arc createArc(java.lang.String streetName,
                     float length,
                     float avgSpeed,
                     int srcNodeId,
                     int destNodeId)
        Factory method to build arcs in the map.
        Parameters:
        streetName - The name of the new arc (the street).
        length - The length in meters.
        avgSpeed - The speed in meters/seconds.
        srcNodeId - The id of the source node, that must exist in the map.
        destNodeId - the id of the dest node, that must exist in the map.
        Returns:
        The arc newly created and added to the map.

      • getNodeById

        public Node getNodeById(int id)
        Returns the node of the map which id is given or null if the id doesn't exists.
        Parameters:
        id - Id of the node to return.
        Returns:
        The node found by its id, or null if it doesn't exist.
